info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 13 at 11:19AM MST until December 14 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...PLAINS BLIZZARD WILL CONTINUE INTO TONIGHT... .A strong winter storm has produced blizzard conditions over much of the plains of northeastern Colorado today. Strong winds are expected to continue to gust up to 60 mph, which will cause blowing and drifting snow through tonight. Cold and very windy conditions will persist behind the storm Wednesday and Thursday. ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions ongoing. Additional snow accumulations up to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Briggsdale, Fort Morgan, Byers, Sterling, and Akron. * WHEN...Until Midnight MST tonight. * IMPACTS...Visibility will be near zero at times resulting in white out conditions. Travel will be treacherous and potentially life-threatening. Road closures and impassable roads are likely.
info.instruction: Consider altering your travel plans. Heavy snowfall is expected to make travel very difficult to impossible.
